title: FPS drop
body:
I used to have low fps even thought I had all my drivers updated and all that. 

I somehow fixed it and was able to play with 80-100 fps which was great since I usually had around 20.

But then my sister installed sims 4 (11.7 gb) and now I cant play LoL at all. I have 20 fps and that's the only thing that's changed on my laptop.

I dont have good laptop, my graphic card is fine, but processor is low (pentium).... 
I also have a lot of free space on (730 gb on disc C). It's not the greatest laptop but it was able to give me 100 fps before all of this....


Why is this happening? Is it because of the sims? Can i fix it somehow without deinstalling the sims? Thanks!

replies.body:
An install of another game should not impact you like this, but I know the uncertainty can be a pain.  Is your battery for the laptop plugged in?  I recommend running through the [FPS issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) guide to help tune up your pc just in case some drivers may be outdated, or in case of some bad game files.  

Keep in mind that if you're not at least meeting the[ minimum requirements ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752654-Minimum-and-Recommended-System-Requirements)then you may run into issues.  Let me know if that clears things up!
